preheader: Portfolio bounces back with strong gains across storage and industrials
opening_paragraph: As of November 26, 2025, after market close, the GenAI-managed portfolio rebounded to 10172, delivering a strong +4.88% gain for Week 7. This marks a decisive turnaround from last week’s pullback, driven by renewed strength in data storage, industrials, and select technology names.

key_insights.title: Storage stocks surge
key_insights.description: Western Digital and Seagate led the rebound, benefiting from renewed demand momentum in the data storage segment.

key_insights.title: Industrials stabilize
key_insights.description: Names like GE Vernova and General Electric posted steady gains, helping offset prior-week weakness in the sector.

key_insights.title: Tech sentiment improves
key_insights.description: Palantir and other tech positions recovered modestly as broader market sentiment stabilized.

market_context: The market experienced renewed strength this week, with data storage and industrials recovering after the prior week’s pullback. Stabilizing risk sentiment supported tech names as well. Looking ahead 1–3 weeks, momentum in storage and industrials may continue if market conditions hold, while tech names could remain sensitive to broader macro shifts.

benchmark_comparison.summary: The GenAI stock portfolio strongly outperformed the S&P 500 benchmark and significantly outpaced Bitcoin this week, reversing last week's downturn.
